question.title: Ninja and Typing
question.content:
Ninja wants to print two strings in a text editor but his keyword allows typing lowercase English letters and backspace only.

Ninja type ‘N’ characters given by string ‘STR1’ to print the first string in the editor, and type ‘M’ characters given by string ‘STR2’ to print the second string. Both ‘STR1’ and ‘STR2’ have lowercase English characters and ‘#’ to denote backspace.

Your task is to return true if both strings that print on the text editor are equal otherwise return false. See the example for more clarity.

Note:
Backspace has no effect on empty text.
Example:
Consider ‘STR1’ = “ade##c#ba”, ‘STR2 = ‘a#ad#b#ba

Both ‘STR1’ and ‘STR2’ print the string “aba” on the text editor, thus we should return true.
Input Format:
The first line contains a single integer ‘T’ representing the number of test cases. 

The first line of each test case will contain two space-separated strings  ‘STR1’ and ’STR2’ respectively.
Output Format:
For each test case, print “true” if both strings that print on the text editor are equals otherwise print “false”

Output for every test case will be printed in a separate line.
Note:
You don’t need to print anything; It has already been taken care of.
Constraints:
1 <= T <= 50
2 <= N <= 10000
0 <= M <= 10000

Time limit: 1 sec
Sample Input 1:
2
ab##  c#d###
ade##c#ba a#ad#b#ba
Sample Output 1:
true
true
Explanation For Sample Input 1:
In the first test case,  Both of them print empty strings.

For the second test case, see the problem statement for an explanation.
Sample Input 2:
2
a#c b
c#c#c  ccc#c#
Sample Output 2:
false
false

rephrased.body: Given two strings, STR1 and STR2, representing characters typed into a text editor. The editor only allows lowercase English letters and backspace ('#').  STR1 and STR2 simulate typing N and M characters respectively.  Backspace removes the last typed character (if any). Determine if the resulting strings displayed in the editor are identical after processing STR1 and STR2.

testcases.explanation: Both strings result in an empty string after processing the backspaces. 'ab##' becomes '' and 'c#d###' becomes ''.
Both strings result in "aba" after processing the backspaces.  'ade##c#ba' becomes 'ade' -> 'ad' -> 'adc' -> 'ad' -> 'aba'. 'a#ad#b#ba' becomes 'a' -> '' -> 'ad' -> 'a' -> 'ab' -> 'a' -> 'aba'.
The first string results in 'c' ('a#' becomes '' then adds 'c'). The second string is 'b'. They are not equal.
The first string processes as 'c' -> '' -> 'c' -> '' -> 'c' and gives ''. The second string processes as 'ccc' -> 'cc' -> 'ccc' -> 'cc' and gives 'cc'. They are not equal.

hints: Use stack to build both strings independently.
Iterate the given strings in reverse order.
